paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information regarding the V122I variant in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Cardiac phenotype and risk for adverse cardiovascular outcomes

functional_data.summary: V122I TTR carriers had higher baseline LV wall thickness and a greater increase in NT-proBNP on follow-up.

variants.additional_notes: The study suggests the need for amyloidosis screening strategies for V122I TTR carriers.
key_quotes: V122I TTR carriers had higher baseline LV wall thickness (LVWT, 8.52±1.82 vs. 8.21±1.62 mm; adjusted P=0.038) than non-carriers.

V122I TTR carriers were at a higher adjusted risk of heart failure (HF) (HR 3.82, 95% CI 1.80-8.13, P<0.001), cardiovascular death (HR 2.65, 95% CI 1.14-6.15, P=0.023), and all-cause mortality (HR 1.95, 95% CI 1.08-3.51, P=0.026).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the V122I variant in TTR.
